intro: Lussa macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf lussa, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Lussa macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
